title: Strictly's Janette Manrara swears live on It Takes Two... forcing Gethin Jones to apologise
text:
Host Gethin Jones was forced to apologise after Janette Manrara accidentally swore live on air.

The Strictly Come Dancing professional dancer made the blunder while she was speaking about performing the Pokémon theme tune Gotta Catch 'em All with celebrity partner.

'I've discovered I am a lot like Pikachu in real life. Apparently fuzzy and cute, but don't p**s Pikachu off,' she said - before Gethin quickly interjected to say sorry to viewers.

Scroll down for video

Oops! Host Gethin Jones was forced to apologise after Janette Manrara accidentally swore live on air

Janette proved to be excited about the upcoming 'Movie Week' number while discussing it, promoting her to swear while sitting on the couch being interviewed.

After saying sorry on behalf of Janette immediately, later while the dancer was showing him some moves, the Welsh presenter stated: '

'This is an apology for the slip of the tongue then from Janette a few seconds ago.'

Meanwhile, Gethin - who had stepped in to host the show on behalf of unwell Zoe Ball- had a close call when he almost slipped and fell while dancing.

Oh no: After saying sorry on behalf of Janette immediately, later while the dancer was showing him some moves the presenter apologised again

Dancer: The Strictly professional dancer made the blunder while she was speaking about performing the Pokémon theme tune Gotta Catch 'em All with celebrity partner

The former Blue Peter host was attempting to make a grand entrance on the show by dancing with Dianne Buswell.

He span around with Dianne before then dancing quickly with Janette Manrara, before he then admitted: 'I nearly fell over.'

Zoe pulled out the show after being left bed-bound with the flu, as she took to Twitter to break the news the fans that she would not be presenting the sister show.

In her tweet Zoe wrote: 'Gutted to say I've been taken down by a nasty bout of flu. Huge apologies for missing the R2 Breakfast Show & It Takes Two. Thanks to @Nicki_Chapman & @GethincJones for stepping in. Promise to be back ASAP.

Showing off his skills: The former Blue Peter host was attempting to make a grand entrance on the show by dancing with Dianne Buswell

Still on his feet: Gethin span around with Dianne before then dancing quickly with Janette Manrara, before he then admitted: 'I nearly fell over'

Announcement: Zoe pulled out the show after being left bed-bound with the flu, as she took to Twitter to break the news the fans that she would not be presenting the sister show

'Sending love to anyone else illin with this flu, it's such a stinker (sic).'

In a statement the BBC added: 'Tonight's It Takes Two will be hosted by 'Strictly' favourite Gethin Jones, as Zoe Ball is unwell.

'Gethin will be joined by Will and Janette, Alex and Neil, and Dev and Dianne for tonight's show.

'Ian Waite will also be at the studio as usual, as Waite's Warm Up gets Strictly fans ready for the weekend.'

It is unclear when Zoe will return to her hosting duties, as she also pulled out of her Radio 2 Breakfast show with Nicki Chapman drafted in to replace her.
description: Host Gethin Jones was forced to apologise after Janette Manrara accidentally swore live on air.
